Archive for September, 2019:

Yongusil 98: Moscow and the Dilemma of Regional Development versus North Korea Sanctions Link: https://sinonk.com/2019/09/30/yongusil-98-moscow-and-the-dilemma-of-regional-development-versus-north-korea-sanctions/

By Anthony Rinna Link: https://sinonk.com/author/anthony-rinna/ | September 30, 2019

Russia’s North Korea policy involves a trade-off: refusal to support UN sanctions hurts Russia internationally, but supporting sanctions damages growth prospects in the country’s easternmost regions. Anthony Rinna covers this dilemma in Asian Studies International Review.

Yongusil 97: On the Academic Misconduct of Charles Armstrong, and Sino-NK’s 2013 Roundtable Link: https://sinonk.com/2019/09/25/yongusil-97-on-the-academic-misconduct-of-charles-armstrong-and-sino-nks-2013-roundtable/

By Sino-NK | September 25, 2019

With the field of Korean Studies (hopefully) chastened by the exposure of Charles Armstrong’s misconduct, Sino-NK reflects on the case and our role in it.

What is Sino-NK?

Sino-NK is a scholarly collective of young Sinologists and Koreanists dedicated to documenting and analyzing the borderland dynamics, transnational ties, and history of Northeast Asia. Work published on Sino-NK is regularly cited in journalistic outlets and our analysts have been featured in a range of academic publications. Sino-NK endeavors to better understand North Korea’s relations with the world and to chart a path forward for digital (and) academic analysis. Read more Link: https://sinonk.com/about-us/
